moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Basic Theory and Practices/09 Strategy Pillars Topics Buckets/Strategy Topics

overview.quote: Topics are focused subjects that live under each pillar – they're where your pillars intersect with what people care about.
overview.introText: Once you've established your pillars, you need to break them down into specific topics that resonate with your audience. These topics are the bridge between your big ideas and the conversations people are already having.

keyTerms.definition: Breaking down pillars into specific subjects that connect with audience interests and current conversations.
How well your chosen topics address problems, questions, or interests your target audience actually has.
Having enough variation within each topic to create multiple pieces of engaging content over time.
Topics that naturally spark engagement, comments, and sharing due to their relevance to current discussions.

actionPlan: List the ways each pillar affects people
Research common problems in each area
Find trending conversations in your field
Aim for 3 strong topics per pillar

mainContent.title: Topics Bridge Pillars to People
mainContent.text: Topics translate your big-picture pillars into focused subjects people actually discuss. They're specific areas where your expertise meets audience interest – like 'toxic boss behaviors' under a 'healthy work culture' pillar.

mainContent.title: Research-Driven Topic Selection
mainContent.text: Find topics through research on Reddit, forums, and comment sections. Look for discussions that generate high engagement and questions people are actually asking. Always ask: 'What can I add to this conversation?'

summaryPoints: Focus on real problems people face

mainContent.title: Building Your Topic Library
mainContent.text: Aim for about three solid topics per pillar to start. These topics should be evergreen enough to support ongoing content but specific enough to connect with real audience needs and interests.

summaryPoints: Choose topics with multiple content angles

proTips.text: Look at what topics your competitors avoid – these gaps might be your opportunity to stand out with unique content.
The best topics often sit at the intersection of what you're passionate about and what keeps your audience up at night.

finalWords.description: Great topics come from understanding what your audience already cares about.
